item.title: How to Minimize Go Apps Container Image
item.author: juneardoc@gmail.com (Clavin June)
item.description: Photo by @ventiviews on Unsplash Introduction Image is one necessary thing that you must plan when you want to containerize your apps. Building a large image means you need more data to transfer between your image repository, CI/CD platform, and deployment server. Creating a smaller container is a must to save time. There’s no need to be difficult when it comes to reducing container image size. Especially with Go apps, it has already come with a binary, which means it doesn’t need any environmental server like Nginx, Node, Etc.
